definition: the five Liang of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Liang 前涼|前凉 (314-376), Later Liang 後涼|后凉 (386-403), Northern Liang 北涼|北凉 (398-439), Southern Liang 南涼|南凉 (397-414), Western Liang 西涼|西凉 (400-421)
"ice" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 15), occurring in 冰[bing1], 次[ci4] etc, known as 兩點水|两点水[liang3 dian3 shui3]
abbr. for Beijing/surname Jing/Jing ethnic minority
capital city of a country/big/algebraic term for a large number (old)/artificial mound (old)
salad with dressing/cold vegetables dressed with sauce (e.g. coleslaw)

sentences.english: The tips of my fingers are cold.
As soon as Indian summer is over, it gets colder with each passing day…
sentences.chinese: 秋老虎刚过，天就一天比一天凉了。

sentences.english: Beat egg white with ginger juice and milk. Stir in sugar syrup.
sentences.chinese: 蛋白混和姜汁及鲜奶，打匀后加入凉了的糖水。

sentences.english: The sun rose to the mid sky and doves cooed in the shade.
sentences.chinese: 太阳升到中天，鸽子在凉荫中叫唤。

sentences.english: It's a bit nippy today; you'd better wear your scarf.
sentences.chinese: 今天有点儿凉，你最好戴上你的围巾。

sentences.english: I can't hang my perennials from a rope and expect positive results.
sentences.chinese: 我不可能把我的种子凉在一边而且还希望它能发芽。

sentences.english: Use paynes gray in a watercolor windmill painting to add cool toned shadows.
sentences.chinese: 在使用佩恩尼斯风车画水彩凉灰色色调添加阴影。

sentences.english: You’d better wear a light jacket, it’s chilly today.
sentences.chinese: 你最好穿件薄夹克，今天有点凉。

sentences.english: Cover the food with a bowl to keep it from getting cold.
sentences.chinese: 用碗把菜扣上，免得凉了。

sentences.english: Wang Lung took up the bowl of cold rice and began to eat.
sentences.chinese: 王龙端起那一碗凉米饭吃了起来。

sentences.english: And in the night to become cool, to lady finds out the thin quilt.
sentences.chinese: 而且夜晚愈发的凉了，给婆婆找出了薄棉被。

sentences.english: Cold creamy soup made with potatoes and leeks.
sentences.chinese: 土豆和韭葱煮成的凉奶油汤。

sentences.english: The eastern facade is composed of loggias covered in bamboo.
sentences.chinese: 东部的门面是由凉廊中涉及竹子。

sentences.english: Autumn wind blows cold weather, the plants exposed to shake off the frost.
sentences.chinese: 秋风萧瑟天气凉，草木摇落露为霜。

sentences.english: It was a hot and humid day recently and I decided that some of my favorite cold soup would be just the ticket.
sentences.chinese: 这些天又热又潮，来一碗我最爱的凉汤再合适不过了。

sentences.english: She knew that as it cooled, it would turn into a waxy solid.
sentences.chinese: 她知道当这罐油脂凉下来时，它会形成蜡状固体。

definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
slightly cold/cool/(neologism) (slang) to be done for/about to be obliterated/(of a place or a person) desolate
warm/lukewarm/temperature/to warm up/mild/soft/tender/to review (a lesson etc)/fever (TCM)/old variant of 瘟[wen1]
chilled to the bone/(of the wind) chilly
